data.title: Meet Greece’s Interim Prime Minister, Lucas Papademos
data.meta_description:
Welcome, or καλωσόρισμα, to Lucas Papademos, who has been newly selected (singled out?) as the interim prime minister of Greece. The New York Times, which is going to totally ace the S.A.T. verbal section on Saturday, characterizes Papademos “a respected economist with an avuncular style.” Indeed, in a televised statement earlier today, Papademos did display qualities of or pertaining to an uncle when discussing the inchoate government. “The course will not be easy,” he said. “But the problems, I’m convinced, will be solved. They will be solved faster, with a smaller cost and in an efficient way, if there is unity, agreement and prudence.” He then promised to teach everyone to drive stick once they turned 16.
According to the Times, Papademos, a former European Central Bank vice president, will attempt to “persuade the Greek Parliament to pass the new austerity measures, which include more layoffs of government workers, in a climate of growing social unrest” and “ensure that Greece [stays] in the euro zone.”
Lame! Driving lessons first, then austerity measures.
data.text:
Welcome, or καλωσόρισμα, to Lucas Papademos, who has been newly selected (singled out?) as the interim prime minister of Greece. The New York Times, which is going to totally ace the S.A.T. verbal section on Saturday, characterizes Papademos “a respected economist with an avuncular style.” Indeed, in a televised statement earlier today, Papademos did display qualities of or pertaining to an uncle when discussing the inchoate government. “The course will not be easy,” he said. “But the problems, I’m convinced, will be solved. They will be solved faster, with a smaller cost and in an efficient way, if there is unity, agreement and prudence.” He then promised to teach everyone to drive stick once they turned 16.

According to the Times, Papademos, a former European Central Bank vice president, will attempt to “persuade the Greek Parliament to pass the new austerity measures, which include more layoffs of government workers, in a climate of growing social unrest” and “ensure that Greece [stays] in the euro zone.”

Lame! Driving lessons first, then austerity measures.

Politics

J.D. Vance, Once a Die-Hard Never Trumper, Completes His MAGAmorphosis

The Ohio Senator and Hillbilly Elegy author took the stage as Donald Trump’s running mate on Wednesday night at the Republican National Convention, where he leaned into his personal biography and struck a populist tone — while side-stepping some issues, like abortion, where he holds extreme views.

Television

Whoopsie: Aaron Sorkin Doesn’t Want Democrats to Nominate Mitt Romney After All

Hours after publishing a New York Times op-ed suggesting the DNC select a Republican as their presidential nominee, the West Wing scribe seemingly went all in for Kamala Harris.

Politics

JD Vance’s Wife: My Husband Only Meant to Insult People Who Actively Choose Not to Have Kids, Not People Who Are Trying but Are Unsuccessful

She did not touch on his claim that people who don’t have kids are more sociopathic.

Celebrity

Céline Dion Will Reportedly Sing A Heartbreaking Classic with Lady Gaga During Olympic Opening Ceremony

According to French journalist Thierry Moreau, the musical icon will perform for the first time in four years Friday, a duet of “La Vie en Rose."
